info.title: RetailOps Channel Integration API
info.description: Integrate a sales channel with RetailOps

integration_auth_token.description: Randomly generated authorization token, for authenticating genuine RetailOps- originated requests.

channel_item_refnum.description: ref number of returned item being credited

item_type.description: The type of RetailOps data item being expressed

item_info.description: Details about the RetailOps data item being expressed

template_output.description: Data structure as provided by the RetailOps feed system template which has been evaluated against the retailops catalog item in question

quantity_detail.description: Detailed breakdown of inventory quantities contributing to the top-line numbers

quantity_type.description: Type of quantity for this item

estimated_availability_date.description: estimated availability date for one unit

available_quantity.description: Quantity which is presently available for sale

total_quantity.description: Total quantity, irrespective of sellability or availability

po.description: PO number corresponding to inflight quantity considered to be available

sku.description: SKU specified by the order item

removed.description: boolean indicator of whether the item was removed from the order.

unshipped_items.description: List of items which were not shipped as of the time of order completion. Presumably these items should be canceled in the channel

sku.description: SKU specified by the order item

ordered_quantity.description: quantity of the order item which was ordered

unshipped_quantity.description: quantity of the order item which has not been shipped

effective_unit_price.description: effective unit price associated with the order item (after discounts), specified in the counterparty currency

effective_extended_price.description: extended price associated with the order item (after discounts), specified in the counterparty currency

shipments.description: List of all fulfilled shipments for this order. Each RetailOps shipment corresponds to one portion of the order routing plan, usually one per each facility or vendor. Each fulfilled shipment will contain one or more packages

channel_ship_code.description: Code which has been configured for this channel to represent the above carrier/class. EG: 'UPS Ground' -> 'UPSGRND' or 'U,GRD'

channel_item_refnum.description: Channel reference number for this item

quantity.description: Quantity of the referenced items which was included in this package

sku.description: SKU specified by the order item

removed.description: boolean indicator of whether the item was removed from the order.

unshipped_items.description: List of items which were not shipped as of the time of order completion. Presumably these items should be canceled in the channel

sku.description: SKU specified by the order item

ordered_quantity.description: quantity of the order item which was ordered

unshipped_quantity.description: quantity of the order item which has not been shipped

effective_unit_price.description: effective unit price associated with the order item (after discounts), specified in the counterparty currency

effective_extended_price.description: extended price associated with the order item (after discounts), specified in the counterparty currency

shipments.description: List of all fulfilled shipments for this order. Each RetailOps shipment corresponds to one portion of the order routing plan, usually one per each facility or vendor. Each fulfilled shipment will contain one or more packages

channel_ship_code.description: Code which has been configured for this channel to represent the above carrier/class. EG: 'UPS Ground' -> 'UPSGRND' or 'U,GRD'

channel_item_refnum.description: Channel reference number for this item

quantity.description: Quantity of the referenced items which was included in this package

orders.description: an array of order information objects

channel_order_refnum.description: channel reference number corresponding to an order from the channel

status.description: Success or fail status of the cancel action. Details should be conveyed in the events data
Indicates whether the order completion was successfully applied to the channel

page_token.description: Initially blank, subsequent calls will specifiy the value returned from next_page_token. Your implementation should encode any state information required for order retrieval into this value. If your channel order retrival implementation requires the data which is encoded in page_token, it MUST handle a blank page_token gracefully, and respond with a valid and appropriate next_page_token

specific_orders.description: RetailOps may occasionally wish to re-fetch a specific order, or small group of orders. When specified, any next_page_token which is provided will be ignored.

items.description: List of specific orders which are desired to be fetched or re-fetched. Any filtering of acknolwedged orders should be disabled for this function

channel_refnum.description: Channel reference number for one of the desired orders

next_page_token.description: In order to affect retieval of large numbers of orders, pagination is generally required. Your implementation should construct a next_page_token value which contains sufficient state information to retrieve the next 'page' of orders. This value will be passed in to a subsequent order_pull call using the page_token field. Return an empty string if there are no additional pages

orders.description: List of orders retrieved from the channel. Cannot exceed 100 orders per request. Your implementation MUST NOT consider the order as having been imported until such time as order_acknolwledge is called with the specific order reference numbers.

channel_order_refnum.description: Channel's identifier for this order. This value will be used for acknowledgement, completion, and other interactions

ship_service_code.description: Code identifying the level of service. Could be generic 'Slow' / 'Fast' or Specific 'Fedex Ground'

currency_code.description: ISO4217 Currency code for the counterparty (transaction) currency

currency_values.description: Currency values which pertain to the whole order, but are not included in the respective item values. EG: if the item shipping is $1 for each of 10 items, for a total of $10, the shipping_amt here should be $0, and the per-item shipping_amt should be $1; If the order shipping is $10 none of which is directly attributable to specific items, then shipping_amt here should be $10

channel_date_created.description: Date the order was created in the channel in ISO8610 format. Don't just use the present time, if it can be avoided.

channel_item_refnum.description: Channel reference number for this order line item

sku.description: SKU number to which this order line item is associated

sku_description.description: Used to describe the item in the case where RetailOps does not have a matching SKU

item_type.description: Item type determines the behavior of the RetailOps order routing system. Use 'ship' for items you wish to be shipped by RetailOps. Use 'advisory' for items which are non-shippable or have already been shipped. Use 'instore' for items which have been purchased in a physical store

payment_processing_type.description: Indicates what type of payment RetailOps should record in its payment system. types beginning with channel_ are delegated to the channel for processing. Other types may be handled directly with the payment processor, if the account is on file

payment_type.description: Payment type for this transaction. Free-form

attributes.description: Attributes which pertain to the order

ip_address.description: IP address used to place order

channel_store_credit_amount.description: store credit issued by channel (if any)

channel_ship_code.description: Code which has been configured for this channel to represent the above carrier/class. EG: 'UPS Ground' -> 'UPSGRND' or 'U,GRD'

channel_item_refnum.description: Channel reference number for this item

quantity.description: Quantity of the referenced items which was included in this package

currency_code.description: ISO4217 Currency code for the counterparty (transaction) currency

payment_processing_type.description: Indicates what type of payment RetailOps should record in its payment system. types beginning with channel_ are delegated to the channel for processing. Other types may be handled directly with the payment processor, if the account is on file

payment_type.description: Payment type for this transaction. Free-form

identifier.description: identify value corresponding to the type
